Package automata.pedestrian

Class Pedestrian

java.lang.Object
automata.pedestrian.Pedestrian
public class Pedestrian extends Object
A pedestrian in the simulation.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    protected static final record 
    Pedestrian.TentativeMovement
    A tentative movement consists of a location (where we should move) and a desirability (the higher the desirability the higher the willingness to move to such location).

    • Pedestrian

      public Pedestrian(int row, int column, PedestrianParameters parameters, CellularAutomaton automaton)
      Constructs a new pedestrian.
      Parameters:
      row - row in scenario where pedestrian will be located.
      column - column in scenario where pedestrian will be located.
      parameters - parameters describing new pedestrian.
      automaton - automaton where this pedestrian evolves.

    • setExitTimeSteps

      public void setExitTimeSteps(int timeSteps)
      Record time (as number of discrete time steps) when pedestrian exited the scenario.
      Parameters:
      timeSteps - number of discrete time steps elapsed when pedestrian exited the scenario.

    • getExitTimeSteps

      public int getExitTimeSteps()
      Number of discrete time steps elapsed when pedestrian exited the scenario.
      Returns:
      number of discrete time steps elapsed when pedestrian exited the scenario.

    • computeTransitionDesirabilities

      public List<Pedestrian.TentativeMovement> computeTransitionDesirabilities()
      Computes transition desirabilities for reachable cells in the neighbourhood on this pedestrian. (the higher the desirability the higher the willingness to move to such location). We do not use the term probability because sum of all desirabilities do not have to be 1.
      Returns:
      List of tentative movements that this pedestrian can make, each one with associate desirability.

    • chooseMovement

      public Optional<Location> chooseMovement()
      Choose randomly pedestrian's next move from those computed by computeTransitionDesirabilities.
      Returns:
      Optional.empty if no move is available or Optional(m) if move m was chosen.

    • paint

      public void paint(Canvas canvas, Color fillColor, Color outlineColor)
      Paint pedestrian in GUI representing the simulation.
      Parameters:
      canvas - Graphical canvas where pedestrian should be drawn.
      fillColor - fill color for drawing pedestrian.
      outlineColor - outline color for drawing of pedestrian.
